requirement: As a savings account holder, I want to receive alerts for unusual spending, so that I can manage my finances more effectively.
generated_gherkin_scenarios:
Feature: Unusual spending alert for savings account holder

Scenario 1: Receive alert for unusual spending
Given I am a logged in user with an active savings account
And my average monthly spending is defined
When I make a transaction that is significantly larger than my average spending
Then I should receive an alert indicating unusual spending

Scenario 2: No alert for usual spending within average range
Given I am a logged in user with an active savings account
And my average monthly spending is defined
When I make a transaction within my average spending range
Then no alert for unusual spending should be received

Scenario 3: Receive no alerts when there is no transaction
Given I am a logged in user with an active savings account
And my average monthly spending is defined
But There are no transactions in my account
Then no alert for unusual spending should be generated

Scenario 4: Receive alert for multiple unusual spending
Given I am a logged in user with an active savings account
And my average monthly spending is defined
When I make multiple transactions that are significantly larger than my average spending
Then I should receive multiple alerts indicating unusual spending

Negative Scenario:

Scenario 5: Failure in receiving alert for unusual spending
Given I am a logged in user with an active savings account
And my average monthly spending is defined
When I make a transaction significantly larger than my average spending
And there is a failure in the alert system
Then I should not receive an alert even though the spending is unusual

requirement: As a account holder, I want to setup automatic savings transfers, so that I can manage my finances more effectively.
generated_gherkin_scenarios:

In order to manage my finances this feature will allow the account holder to set up automatic savings transfer.

Given a logged in account holder
And valid banking details
When the account holder sets up an automatic savings transfer
Then the system should validate the details
And create the automatic savings transfer successfully.

Scenario 2: Setting up automatic savings transfer with invalid banking details
Given a logged in account holder

And the automatic savings transfer setup should fail.

Scenario 3: Attempting to set up automatic savings transfer without being logged in

requirement: As a mobile app user, I want to dispute incorrect charges, so that I can manage my finances more effectively.
generated_gherkin_scenarios:
Feature: Dispute incorrect charges

Scenario: User disputes an incorrect charge successfully
    Given I am a registered mobile app user 
    And I am logged into my account 
    And I navigate to the 'Manage Finances' section 
    And I have recorded charges in my account
    When I select a charge that is incorrect 
    And I click on 'Dispute Charge' 
    Then the system validates the disputed charge 
    And the system confirms the charge has been disputed successfully

Scenario: User fails to dispute an incorrect charge
    Given I am a registered mobile app user 
    And I am logged into my account 
    And I navigate to the 'Manage Finances' section
    And I have no recorded charges in my account
    When I attempt to dispute a charge 
    Then the system notifies me that there are no charges to dispute

Scenario: Unregistered user attempts to dispute a charge
    Given I am not a registered mobile app user 
    When I attempt to login and dispute a charge 
    Then the system does not allow me to login 
    And the system informs me to register before disputing charges

Scenario: User tries to dispute charge without selecting it
    Given I am a registered mobile app user 
    And I am logged into my account 
    And I navigate to the 'Manage Finances' section 
    And I have recorded charges in my account
    When I click on 'Dispute Charge' without selecting a charge 
    Then the system shows a error message asking to select a charge before disputing

As a homeowner, I want to track mortgage payments and equity, so that I can manage my finances more effectively.

Given I am a homeowner with a mortgage

And: The system calculates the equivalent amount of currency 'B' for 'X' units of currency 'A'
And: The equivalent currency 'B' amount is displayed to the user

Scenario: Negative Scenario - Invalid Currency Conversion
Given: I am an authenticated account holder
And: I have a default currency set for my account
When: I request to convert 'X' units of currency 'A' to currency 'C' which is not supported 
Then: The system does not fetch the live rates for currency 'A' to 'C'
And: The system displays a warning message indicating that currency 'C' is not supported

Scenario: Negative Scenario - Unauthenticated access
Given: I am not an authenticated account holder
When: I request to convert 'X' units of currency 'A' to currency 'B'
Then: The system does not allow me to access the currency conversion service
And: The system displays a warning message indicating that I need to login to access the service.

requirement: As a financial analyst, I want to dispute incorrect charges, so that I can manage my finances more effectively.

This feature allows financial analysts to dispute any incorrect charges they may encounter, helping manage their finances more effectively.

Scenario 1: Dispute an incorrect charge
Given the financial analyst is logged into the financial management system
And the analyst identifies an incorrect charge on his account
When the analyst chooses to dispute the incorrect charge
Then the system should initiate a dispute process for the incorrect charge
And the charge status should be shown as "Under Dispute" until resolution.

Scenario 2: Unable to dispute a correct charge
Given the financial analyst is logged into the financial management system
And the analyst identifies a charge which is correct on his account
When the analyst attempts to dispute the correct charge

And an error message should be shown "Cannot dispute a correct charge".

Scenario 3: Continue with other operations after dispute initiation
Given the financial analyst has initiated a dispute for an incorrect charge
When the analyst continues to use the financial management system for other operations
Then the system should allow the analyst to perform other operations 
And the dispute process for the incorrect charge should continue in the background.

requirement: As a loan applicant, I want to set savings goals and track progress, so that I can manage my finances more effectively.
generated_gherkin_scenarios:
Feature: Savings Goals Tracker
This feature allows loan applicants to manage their finances by setting savings goals and tracking the progress.

Scenario 1: Positively setting savings goals
Given the loan applicant has an existing account 
And logged into the account 
And is on the dashboard page 
When the applicant enters a valid savings goal 
And clicks on 'Save'
Then the system should accept the savings goal 
And display a success message 'Savings goal has been set successfully'

Scenario 2: Negatively setting savings goals
Given the loan applicant has an existing account 
And logged into the account 
And is on the dashboard page 
When the applicant enters an invalid (e.g. Negative or Zero value) savings goal 
And clicks on 'Save'
Then the system should reject the input
And display an error message 'Invalid savings goal. Please enter a positive value.'

Scenario 3: Positively tracking the savings progress
Given the loan applicant has an existing account 
And logged into the account 
And has set a savings goal 
When they navigate to 'Track Progress'
Then the system should display current progress of savings towards the set goal.

Scenario 4: Negatively tracking the savings progress
Given the loan applicant has an existing account 
And logged into the account 
And has not set a savings goal 
When they navigate to 'Track Progress'
Then the system should display a message 'No savings goal set. Please set your savings goal to track progress.'

Please note that in all these scenarios, 'loan applicant' is an actor, the conditions before performing the action are 'preconditions', the steps are 'actions', and the end results are 'expected outcomes'.
